subject: AI & Agents
title: AI and the Right to Be Forgotten
description: Learn AI and the Right to Be Forgotten in one minute.

hook.text: You delete your social media account. But an AI trained on your posts still remembers your patterns.

buildup.text: Models absorb training data into their weights. Individual data points can't be cleanly extracted.

discovery.text: Machine unlearning is an emerging field trying to remove specific data from trained models.

twist.text: Retraining from scratch is the only guaranteed method â€” and it costs millions of dollars.

climax.text: The EU's right to erasure clashes with the technical reality of how AI stores knowledge.

punchline.text: Deleting data is easy. Deleting what AI learned from it isn't.

quiz.question: Why is the right to be forgotten challenging for AI?
options: Models can't easily remove specific data from their weights
Laws don't apply to AI companies
